column5: surprisingly kijiji is not turning up much  can anyone suggest a local source

We used to get our firewood from a flooring mill in the Belwood area. They deliver and it's all kiln dried hardwood flooring off cuts. A lot of little stuff but it burns well and is cheap. I think they were charging under $100 for a truck load delivered to our place up by the marsh. We made a bin lined with chicken wire to hold the wood and just tossed it in the bin. No stacking needed.

Uhg....just finished felling, blocking, splitting and stacking about 3 bush cords of dead standing ash. Nice stuff, but firewood is a bad word to me right now! I should be good for winter now. Have a good stack of maple from last year ready to go too.  No clue about a supplier in your area, sorry.  S.
Are you in the KW area? there is a place at Trussler and Huron
Thanks KW is a bit far.  Found someone in Fergus.
